"And whoever turns away from the remembrance of the Most Merciful - We appoint for him a devil, and he is to him a companion." (az-Zukhruf/43: 36)

And the word of Allah SWT:

"(It will be said to the angels), "Gather those who wronged, their kinds, and what they used to worship." (ash-Shaffat/37: 22)

At the end of the verse, it is explained that Satan is very ungrateful to his Lord, meaning very ungrateful for the blessings Allah has given him, and does not want to be grateful for them. In fact, Satan rebels and refuses to obey Allah's commands, and tempts humans to commit acts of disobedience.

Al-Karkhi explains the condition of a person who is given glory and abundant wealth. If that person uses that wealth and glory beyond the limits that Allah is pleased with, then he has denied Allah's blessings. A person who acts like that, whether in character or actions, can be equated with the actions of Satan.

This verse was revealed by Allah to explain the actions of the people of Jahiliyyah. It had become a habit of the Arabs to hoard wealth that they obtained from spoils of war, robbery, and banditry. They then used this wealth for extravagance in order to gain fame. The Quraysh polytheists also used their wealth to hinder the spread of Islam, weaken its adherents, and help the enemies of Islam. That verse was revealed to state how bad their efforts were.
text.28: This verse explains the proper attitude towards people who are in dire need of help, while the person being asked for help does not have the ability to help. If this happens to someone, then they should speak to that person with polite and gentle words. If they have the ability at another time, then they should make a promise that can be fulfilled and satisfy them.
text.29:
Furthermore, in this verse, Allah swt explains the good ways to spend wealth. Allah describes the state of stingy and extravagant people by using the expressions "do not make your hand chained to your neck, nor extend it completely." These two expressions are commonly used by the Arabs. The first means a prohibition against being miserly or stingy, so that one is reluctant to give wealth to others, even a little. The second expression means prohibiting a person from being extravagant in spending wealth, so that it exceeds their ability. The habit of wasting wealth will result in a person not having savings or reserves that can be used when needed.

From this verse, it can be understood that the good way to spend wealth is in a thrifty, decent, and reasonable manner, neither too stingy nor too extravagant. Being too stingy will make a person blameworthy, while being too extravagant will cause the perpetrator to become bankrupt.

As for the explanations obtained from the hadith of the Prophet, they can be presented as follows:

Imam Ahmad and other hadith scholars narrated from Ibn 'Abbas that the Messenger of Allah saw said:

"A person who is thrifty will never become poor."

This hadith explains the importance of thrift, so the Prophet said that a person who is always thrifty will not become a burden to others or become poor.

Imam al-Baihaqi narrated a hadith from Ibn 'Abbas that the Messenger of Allah saw said:

"Being thrifty in spending wealth is half of livelihood."
text.30:
Then Allah SWT explains that He is the One who expands provision for whomever He wills, and He is also the One who restricts it. Everything proceeds according to the decree that Allah has established for His servants in their efforts to seek wealth and the ways to develop it. This is closely related to the tools and knowledge about managing that wealth. Such is the general decree of Allah that applies to all His servants. Nevertheless, only Allah determines according to His will.

At the end of this verse, Allah SWT affirms that He is All-Knowing of His servants, who among them utilize wealth for good and who use it for harm. He also knows who among His servants, in poverty, remain patient and trust in Allah, and who, because of poverty, become those who despair and are far from the mercy of Allah. Allah is All-Seeing of how they manage and arrange their possessions, whether they spend the wealth given by Allah extravagantly or miserly.

Therefore, Muslims should adhere to the decrees of Allah, by obeying all His commands and avoiding His prohibitions. In spending wealth, one should be moderate. That is part of the *sunnah* of Allah.
text.31:
Then Allah swt forbade the Muslims from killing their children, as some tribes from the Jahiliyyah Arabs had done. They buried their daughters because they were considered incapable of earning a livelihood, and only a burden on life. This was different from sons, who were considered to have the ability to earn wealth, fight wars, and protect family honor. Daughters were seen as only bringing shame because they could cause poverty and lower the family's status by marrying someone not equal to them. Moreover, in war, daughters would certainly become prisoners, so it was not impossible that they would suffer a humiliating fate as slaves. Therefore, Allah swt forbade the Muslims from imitating this Jahiliyyah custom, giving the reason that sustenance is in His power. He is the One who provides sustenance to them. If He is able to provide sustenance to sons, then He is also able to provide it to daughters. Allah stated that fear of poverty is not a reason to kill their daughters.

At the end of this verse, Allah swt emphasizes that killing children is a major sin, because it hinders the purpose of human life. Not allowing a child to live means cutting off offspring, which also means eradicating human life itself from the face of the earth. The following hadith of the Prophet saw illustrates how great the sin of killing a child is:

It is narrated from 'Abdullah bin Mas'ud that he asked, "O Messenger of Allah, which sin is the greatest?" The Messenger of Allah replied, "That you associate partners with Allah, even though Allah is the One who created you." I asked again, "Then which sin?" The Messenger of Allah saw replied, "That you kill your child for fear that the child will eat with you." I asked again, "Then which sin?" The Messenger of Allah saw replied, "That you commit adultery with your neighbor's wife." (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim)

In addition, it can be said that the act of killing a child for fear of starvation is included in having bad thoughts about Allah. If this action is done for fear of shame, then this action is contrary to human values, because it leads to efforts to destroy the continuity of the existence of mankind in the world.

In addition to revealing the evil habits practiced by the Arabs in the Jahiliyyah era, this verse also reveals their very stingy nature.
text.32:
In this verse, Allah swt forbids His servants from approaching the act of *zina* (unlawful sexual intercourse). The meaning is to engage in actions that lead to *zina*, such as uncontrolled free mixing between men and women, reading stimulating materials, watching soap operas and films that exploit female sensuality, and the proliferation of pornography and pornographic acts. All of these truly create a conducive situation for the occurrence of *zina*.

The prohibition of committing *zina* is expressed with the prohibition of approaching *zina* to give a firm impression that if approaching *zina* is already forbidden, what more committing it. With such an expression, one can understand that the prohibition of committing *zina* is a strict prohibition, so it must be completely avoided.

What is meant by the act of *zina* is sexual intercourse committed by a man with a woman outside of marriage, whether the man or woman has previously had a legitimate sexual relationship or not, and not due to a mistake.

Furthermore, Allah gives the reason why *zina* is forbidden. The reason mentioned at the end of this verse is because *zina* is truly a heinous act that causes much damage, including:

1.  Destroying lineage, which causes a person to doubt the lineage of their child, whether the child born is their descendant or the result of *zina*. A husband's suspicion that his wife has committed *zina* with another man leads to various difficulties, such as divorce and difficulties in the education and legal status of the child. Such a situation disrupts the child's psychological development and destroys the social order.

2.  Causing upheaval and anxiety in society, because honor is not maintained. How many murders occur in society because members of that society commit *zina*.

3.  Destroying the peace of married life. The reputation of a woman or man who has committed *zina* will be tarnished in the midst of society. The peace of married life will never materialize, and the loving relationship between husband and wife will be damaged.

4.  Destroying the household. A wife is not merely a means of satisfying lust, but a life partner in married life and building the welfare of the household. Therefore, if the husband is responsible for meeting the needs of the household, then the wife is responsible for maintaining it, both property and children and the order of the household. So if the wife or husband is tainted by *zina*, the destruction of the household is difficult to avoid.

5.  The spread of *zina* in society leads to the development of various sexually transmitted diseases such as syphilis. In addition, it also increases the spread of AIDS or diseases that destroy the immune system of the sufferer, so that he will die slowly.

In short, it can be stated that the act of *zina* is a very heinous act, which causes the destruction of lineage, causes upheaval and anxiety in society, destroys the peace of married life, destroys the household itself, and degrades human dignity. If this act is allowed to run rampant in the midst of society, it means that humans are equal in rank to animals.

This verse contains a prohibition against committing *zina* and an indication of the behavior of the people of Arab *Jahiliyyah* (ignorance) who were wasteful. *Zina* is a cause of extravagance.
text.33:
In this verse, Allah SWT forbids His servants from killing a soul that Allah has made sacred. The meaning of "killing a soul" is taking a human life. While what is meant by "that which Allah has forbidden to kill" is killing for reasons that are not valid or not permitted by religion.

As for the reason why Allah SWT forbids His servants from taking human life for reasons that are not justified, it is:

1.  Killing causes damage. Islam forbids any action that causes damage. This prohibition applies generally to all kinds of actions that cause damage, so killing is also a prohibited action. Allah SWT says:

   "...and do not cause corruption upon the earth after its reformation..." (al-A'raf/7: 85)

2.  Killing endangers others. The basic principle in religion is that all actions that cause harm to oneself and others are forbidden. Allah SWT says:

   "...whoever kills a soul unless for a soul or for corruption [done] in the land - it is as if he had slain mankind entirely..." (al-Ma'idah/5: 32)

   The Prophet Muhammad SAW said:

   "The disappearance of the world is less significant to Allah than the killing of a Muslim." (Narrated by at-Tirmidhi from 'Abdullah bin 'Umar)

3.  It disrupts the security of society, which leads to the destruction of that society itself. Because if killing is allowed, it is not impossible that there will be acts of mutual killing among humans, which will ultimately lead to the destruction of humanity.

   "But whoever kills a believer intentionally - his recompense is Hell, wherein he will abide eternally, and Allah has become angry with him and has cursed him and prepared for him a great punishment." (an-Nisa'/4: 93)

In this verse, Allah SWT provides an exception as to who may be killed through His words, "except for a just cause." Among these are a man or woman who commits adultery after being bound by the law of marriage and a person who intentionally kills a believer who is protected by law.

Such exceptions are mentioned in a hadith of the Prophet:

"It is not permissible to shed the blood of a Muslim who bears witness that there is no god but Allah and that I am the Messenger of Allah, except in one of three cases: a life for a life (murder), a married person who commits adultery, and one who forsakes his religion and separates from the community." (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim from 'Abdullah)

Then Allah SWT explains what actions should be taken by the heirs of the deceased, and who should carry out these actions if, by chance, the deceased has no heirs.

Allah SWT stipulates that whoever is killed unjustly, that is, without a valid reason, then Allah has given the authority or right to his heirs to determine the choice of punishment for the killer, namely between the law of *qishash* (retaliation) or accepting *diyat* (blood money), as has been established in His word:

"O you who have believed, prescribed for you is legal retribution for those murdered..." (al-Baqarah/2: 178). (See further interpretation of this verse in volume I).

And the words of the Prophet Muhammad SAW when conquering the city of Mecca:

"Whoever kills, then the family of the slain is given the right to choose between two things; if they want, they can demand the death penalty, and if they want, they can demand *diyat* (blood money)." (Narrated by Abu Dawud and an-Nasa'i from Abu Syuraih al-Khuza'i)

Then, if by chance the deceased has no heirs, then the ruler will act in his place in determining the choice of punishment. In this case, the ruler may delegate his authority to the local *qadhi* (judges), if deemed necessary.

In carrying out *qishash*, the rulers who are authorized to carry it out are ordered not to exceed the limits that have been set, as happened in the time of *Jahiliyyah* (ignorance). People in the time of *Jahiliyyah* were not satisfied with only demanding revenge with the death of the person who killed, but also demanded the death of another person, if the deceased was from the nobility. If the deceased was a nobleman, while the killer was from the common people, then the death of a nobleman was also demanded as a replacement for the killer.

In verse 178 of Surah al-Baqarah, there is a strong indication that the most important punishment for the family of the deceased is to simply demand *diyat* or forgive, not to demand revenge for death.

At the end of the verse, Allah SWT explains that the heirs or rulers in carrying out the *qisas* punishment must not exceed the limits because they receive help from Allah, in the form of retribution to choose the *qisas* punishment or the *diyat* punishment. Therefore, judges should be guided by these provisions in deciding cases. Do not make decisions that contradict Allah's regulations or exceed the applicable provisions.

This verse is classified as a Makkiyah verse and is included in the first part of the law verses to be revealed. Thus, it is natural that this verse only regulates the law for murder in general terms. As for the detailed explanation, it is regulated in other verses, the interpretation of which has been presented in volume I.
text.34:
Then Allah swt forbade His servants from approaching the wealth of orphans, except in a good way. Approaching the wealth of orphans means using the wealth of orphans inappropriately or not providing protection for that wealth, so that it is wasted. Allah swt provides protection for the wealth of orphans because they desperately need it, while they are not yet able to manage their wealth and cannot yet earn a living on their own.

However, Allah swt makes an exception, namely if expenses are needed for the maintenance of that wealth, or with the intention of developing it, then it is permissible for the person who takes care of the orphan to take a portion of it in a reasonable manner.

Therefore, a responsible person is needed to manage the wealth of orphans. The person assigned to carry out this task is called a *washiy* (guardian), and a body or institution is also needed to manage the wealth of orphans. The activities of this body or institution should be supervised by the government, so that there is no misuse or embezzlement of the wealth of orphans.

Then, in this verse, it is explained that if the orphan has reached adulthood and has the ability to manage and develop his wealth, it means that it is time for the guardian to return the wealth to him.

After that verse was revealed, the companions of the Messenger of Allah who cared for orphans were afraid, so they did not want to eat and associate with them. Therefore, Allah revealed this verse:

And if you mix your affairs with them, then they are your brothers. Allah knows the mischief-maker and the reformer. (al-Baqarah/2: 220)

From this verse, it is clear that spending the wealth of orphans is prohibited if it is used for personal gain. However, if it is spent for the maintenance of the wealth itself, or for the needs of the orphan, and the guardian is truly a person who is unable to support himself, then it is not prohibited. Allah swt says:

And do not consume their property beyond what is reasonable, nor hasten to consume it before they grow up. Whoever (among the guardians) is rich, let him abstain (from consuming the orphan's property), and whoever is poor, let him consume it according to what is acceptable. (an-Nisa'/4: 6)

Allah swt commands His servants to fulfill promises, both promises to Allah and promises made with fellow human beings, namely contracts of buying and selling and leasing, which are included in the field of *muamalah*.

Az-Zajjaj explained that all of Allah's commands and prohibitions are Allah's promises that must be fulfilled, including promises that must be declared to one's Lord, and promises made between servant and servant.

What is meant by fulfilling a promise is carrying out what has been stipulated in the agreement, without deviating from the provisions of religion and applicable law.

At the end of the verse, Allah swt affirms that indeed, promises must be accounted for. People who betray promises, or unilaterally cancel promises, will receive a fitting recompense.
text.35:
Furthermore, Allah commands the Muslims to perfect the measure when measuring merchandise. The intention is that when measuring goods, it should be done as accurately and precisely as possible. Therefore, a person who measures merchandise to be handed over to another after it has been sold should not reduce the measure, as it is detrimental to others. Likewise, if a person measures another person's merchandise that he will receive after buying it, it should not be increased, as it is also detrimental to others.

Allah swt also commands them to weigh goods with a correct balance (scale) that conforms to established standards. A correct balance is one that is made as meticulously as possible, so that it can give confidence to those who engage in buying and selling, and does not allow for fraudulent additions or subtractions.

Allah swt threatens those who reduce measures and weights with severe threats. Allah swt says:

"Woe to those who give less [than what is due], Who, when they take a measure from people, take in full, And when they give a measure or weight to them, cause loss." (al-Muthaffifin/83: 1-3)

At the end of the verse, Allah swt explains that measuring or weighing goods carefully is better in its consequences for them because in this world they gain the trust of members of society, and in the Hereafter they will receive rewards from Allah and His pleasure, and be protected from the fire of Hell.
text.36:
Allah SWT forbids Muslims from following words or actions whose truth is unknown. This prohibition encompasses all human activities, both words and deeds.

To gain a deeper understanding of the content of this verse, the following are various opinions from the companions (sahabah) and the successors (tabi'in):

1. Ibn 'Abbas said, "Do not give testimony except for what you have seen with your own eyes, what you have heard with your ears, and what your heart knows with full awareness."

2. Qatadah said, "Do not say, 'I have heard,' when you have not heard, and do not say, 'I have seen,' when you have not seen, and do not say, 'I have known,' when you have not known."

3. Another opinion states that what is meant by the prohibition of saying something that is not known is speech based only on conjecture and speculation, not true knowledge, as stated in Allah's word:

O you who have believed, avoid much [negative] assumption. Indeed, some assumption is sin. (al-Hujurat/49: 12)

And as stated in the hadith:

Beware of suspicion, for suspicion is the falsest of speech. (Narrated by Muslim, Ahmad, and at-Tirmizi from Abu Hurairah)

4. Some also hold the opinion that what is meant is the prohibition for the polytheists to follow the beliefs of their ancestors, with blind imitation and following the desires of their lusts. Among them is following the beliefs of their ancestors in worshiping idols, and giving those idols various names, as stated in Allah's word:

They are not but [mere] names you have named them - you and your forefathers - for which Allah has sent down no authority. (an-Najm/53: 23)

Allah SWT then says that indeed, hearing, sight, and the heart will be asked whether what someone says is in accordance with what his conscience hears. If what is said is in accordance with hearing, sight, and conscience, he is saved from the threat of hellfire, and will receive reward and Allah's pleasure. But if it is not in accordance, he will certainly be driven into hellfire.

Allah SWT says:

On the Day when their tongues, their hands, and their feet will bear witness against them as to what they used to do. (an-Nur/24: 24)

And the hadith narrated by Syakal bin Humaid, he said:

I visited the Prophet SAW, then I said, "O Prophet, teach me a supplication for protection that I will recite to seek protection from Allah." Then the Prophet took my hand and said, "Say, "I seek refuge in You (O Allah) from the evil of my hearing, the evil of my sight, the evil of my heart, and the evil of my semen (zina)." (Narrated by Muslim)
text.37:
Allah forbids Muslims from walking on the earth with arrogance. Walking arrogantly on the earth is not a natural attitude, because no matter how hard the stamping of feet on the earth, it will not penetrate its surface, and no matter how high one raises their head, it will not surpass the height of mountains. Even from a psychological perspective, a person who habitually walks with arrogance indicates a weakness in their soul. They feel inferior, so to cover up their weaknesses, they walk arrogantly and act pretentiously with the intention of attracting the attention of others.

Allah SWT emphasizes that they will never be able to penetrate the earth or match the height of mountains. This aims to make Muslims aware of the weaknesses within themselves, to be humble, and not to be arrogant. Because, as humans with limited abilities, they will not be able to achieve something beyond their capabilities.

In this verse, there is also a rebuke for the polytheists who like to boast, flaunt themselves because of wealth and squander it, like to get drunk, and commit adultery.
text.38: Then Allah SWT explains that all of His prohibitions mentioned before this verse, such as associating partners with Allah, being disobedient to parents, being wasteful, killing female children, committing adultery, killing a person whose killing is forbidden, consuming the property of orphans, reducing or increasing measurements and weights, following words and deeds whose truth is unknown, and being arrogant are actions that He greatly detests. Those who commit them deserve to be threatened with severe punishment and must be felt in this world. In the Hereafter, they will receive a painful torment.
text.39:
In this verse, it is explained that Allah's guidance, in the form of His commands that must be followed, and all prohibitions that must be avoided, as mentioned in the previous verses, if obeyed, will surely guide humanity to prosperity in this world and happiness in the hereafter. This is because all of that is part of the wisdom that Allah revealed to His Messenger, in the form of religious regulations.

Furthermore, Allah swt repeats the prohibition against taking gods besides Allah. The repetition of the prohibition against associating other gods with Allah, which implies the command to adhere to the religion of *tauhid* (monotheism), indicates that *tauhid* is the core of all heavenly religions, and the starting point and ultimate goal of all matters concerning all creation. All creation belongs to Allah and to Him all will return.

At the end of the verse, Allah swt affirms that the consequence that the *musyrikin* (polytheists) will experience is that they will be cast into Hell in a state of reproach, whether that reproach comes from others or from themselves, and distanced from Allah's mercy. They will not receive help from anyone.
text.40:
Allah SWT refutes the assumption of the polytheists of Mecca that angels are daughters of Allah, by asking whether it is fitting for your Lord to choose sons for you, while He Himself takes daughters from among the angels. This question contains a denial of their assumption that Allah SWT has daughters in the form of angels. Allah's refutation, in this verse, by showing the error of their way of thinking, aims to make them understand their error. How is it possible that Allah SWT, who created the heavens and the earth and the things that are between them, is said to have daughters in the form of angels, while they themselves prefer to have sons and hate daughters. They even bury their daughters alive. In this case, they attribute a characteristic to Allah that they themselves do not like. Their way of thinking is truly chaotic. They attribute to the One and Most Glorious Being a characteristic that is low in their own view. Such an assumption results in three kinds of errors.

1. They assume that the angels are daughters.

2. They assume that angels are daughters of Allah.

3. They worship those angels.

Allah SWT says:

"Then ask them (O Muhammad), "Are daughters for your Lord and sons for them?" Or did We create the angels as females while they were witnesses? Unquestionably, it is out of their [invented] falsehood that they say, "Allah has begotten." And indeed, they are liars." (ash-shaffat/37: 149-152)

Allah SWT affirms that with that statement, the polytheists have uttered a statement of great sin. They have fabricated a lie against Allah, and therefore are threatened with a painful punishment. They have also wasted their own minds, because they have twisted the truth that they should have upheld.

And they say, "The Most Merciful has taken a son." You have certainly done a grave thing. The heavens almost rupture therefrom and the earth splits open and the mountains collapse in devastation. That they attribute to the Most Merciful a son. And it is not appropriate for the Most Merciful that He should take a son. (Maryam/19: 88-92) (See also al-Baqarah/2: 116)
text.41: This verse explains that in the Qur'an, Allah has given warnings repeatedly, both in the form of proofs of the truth of Allah's existence through His creations, and reasons that show the truth of *tauhid*. The Qur'an also contains several stories about the fate of communities that associated partners with Allah, so that the polytheists of Mecca could learn from these various events and stop their polytheism and bad habits. These repeated explanations and warnings should have softened their hearts and awakened their minds, so that they would be willing to follow the call of the Qur'an. However, these explanations only made them run away from the Qur'an. They did not want to listen to and accept its truth because their souls had been defiled by bad habits. They could no longer judge a truth as truth; instead, they distanced themselves from it and preferred to wallow in falsehood.
text.42:
Then Allah SWT refuted the beliefs of the polytheists of Mecca by commanding His Messenger to say to them that if there were gods besides Him, surely those gods they associated with Him would seek a way to convey what they wanted to Allah, the Possessor of the Throne, whose power encompasses the heavens, the earth, and other things. Of course, the gods they associated with Him would first plead and humble themselves before Him. So, their way of asking Allah through intermediaries is taking a circuitous route. Why don't they directly worship and ask only Allah, the One and Only?

This verse contains a subtle rebuke to the polytheists of Mecca, urging them to worship only Allah, the One and Only, and forbidding them from inventing other gods as intermediaries who can convey their desires to the One and Only. Allah does not like the existence of intermediaries as they believe, and indeed, Allah has forbidden humans from creating such intermediaries through the revelation conveyed by His messengers.
text.43:
Furthermore, Allah SWT declares His holiness from the attributes fabricated by the polytheists of Mecca. Allah SWT affirms that He is Holy and Exalted above all the attributes they fabricated. What they say is only based on conjecture and assumptions. He is Allah, the One and Only, upon Whom all things depend. He begets not, nor is He begotten. And there is nothing comparable to Him.

In that verse, there is an indication that Allah SWT is Perfect, both in His essence and attributes, and Holy from any deficiency, in the truest sense of the word.
text.44:
Then Allah swt explained how vast His kingdom is and how high His power is. The seven heavens, the earth, and all the creatures within them glorify and exalt His names, and witness the proofs of His Oneness. There is not a single creature that does not glorify Him with praise. Anyone who wants to pay attention to the creatures or objects around them will surely know that both living creatures and inanimate objects are all subject and submissive to Allah's decrees or provisions that cannot be avoided.

An example is the law of gravity. This law applies universally and affects all existing objects, whether they are gas, liquid, solid, or living things. All are affected by the law of gravity. This shows that the law of gravity, which has such a great influence, could not have happened by chance, but there is someone who created and controls it at all times. The Creator is certainly the Most Mighty and All-Powerful, namely Allah swt.

The law of gravity is sufficient proof that all objects and creatures on this earth are subject and submissive to Allah's laws and provisions. If someone wants to escape the influence of the earth's gravity, they must use knowledge that can release them from that gravity. To master that knowledge, they must master the law of action and reaction, namely an action that can overcome the earth's gravity, so that they can free themselves from the influence of its power. A person's success in escaping the earth's gravity does not mean that they are not subject to Allah's law, but rather that they can free themselves because they are subject to another natural law. This shows how vast Allah's power is in creating natural laws. That is just the natural laws that humans have known, not to mention other natural laws that humans still do not know.

Especially for humans, creatures with reason, because they consist of physical and spiritual aspects, their physical bodies are subject to these natural laws, whether desired or not. Meanwhile, their souls are required to follow Allah's guidance conveyed through revelation to His Messenger.

The scholars of *ilmu kalam* say that Allah, the Creator of the universe, is *wajibul wujud* (whose existence is obligatory), while creatures are called *mumkinat al-wujud* (whose existence is possible). *Al-Mumkinat* are divided into those with reason and those without reason. Creatures with reason acknowledge the Oneness of Allah because they can observe the signs of Allah's power in the heavens, on the earth, and in all the objects that exist in both. Therefore, the lips of believing humans always glorify Allah with praise. Meanwhile, creatures without reason are subject to *aá¸¥kam kauniyyah* (namely the natural laws created by Allah that apply to natural objects). They glorify Allah with praise by behaving according to the circumstances destined for each of them.

Allah then explained that the polytheists of Mecca did not know that natural objects and all creatures glorified Him with praise, because they did not want to acknowledge the Oneness of Allah. In fact, they made other gods who were associated with Allah. The polytheists did not want to see and think about the submission of the universe and all objects and creatures on earth to natural laws, as a reflection of their glorification of Allah swt.

Looking at several Surahs of the Al-Qur'an (al-Baqarah/2: 29; al-An'am/6: 125), the sky is divided into seven layers. If we assume scientifically that the word "sky" here is the atmosphere, the sky closest to the earth, and not outer space, then the knowledge that humans currently possess confirms this.

The division into seven layers is based on differences in chemical content and air temperature that vary in each layer. The seven layers are called Troposphere, Stratosphere, Mesosphere, Thermosphere, Exosphere, Ionosphere and Magnetosphere. The mention of seven layers of sky is also expressed in Surah Nuh/71: 15 and al-Naba'/78: 12. Furthermore, in Surah Fushshilat/41: 11-12 it is stated that each layer of sky has its own affairs. This is confirmed by science, for example, there is a layer that is responsible for making rain, preventing damage from radiation, reflecting radio waves, up to a layer that prevents meteors from damaging the earth.

This verse symbolically shows that the glorification of objects in nature physically is their (voluntary) obedience to Allah's laws that govern them, also called *sunatullah*. Allah's law is known to humans as natural law or the principles of scientific knowledge known to humans (experts) and applies to all creatures including humans (physically).

As for what is meant by "you do not understand their glorification" is that most humans do not understand *sunatullah* or natural law, which is only understood by experts. So only people with intellect and knowledge can understand natural law and thus also understand the glorification of objects between the seven heavens and the earth.

At the end of the verse, Allah swt affirms that indeed He is Most Forbearing. Therefore, He does not immediately send down punishment for the polytheism of the polytheists of Mecca and for their negligence in not paying attention to the signs of Allah's power, the Most Forgiving. Among Allah's attributes of forgiveness is that He still opens the door of repentance as wide as possible to anyone who asks for His forgiveness. Allah will not punish them for the sins they have committed, if they repent and regret their actions with true regret, truly stop polytheism, return to the religion of monotheism, and follow the guidance of revelation revealed to His Messenger.
text.45:
Allah SWT explains that when the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) recited the Qur'an to the polytheists with the intention that their hearts would be opened to accept the truth contained within it, Allah SWT created an invisible barrier that covered the space between the Messenger of Allah and the polytheists who did not believe in the Hereafter.

This invisible barrier is something that prevents the hearts of the polytheists from understanding the content of the Qur'an, so that they cannot benefit from the guidance and lessons contained within it. This is a consequence of their denial of the Day of Resurrection and the Day of Judgment, as well as the result of the stains of polytheism that have enveloped their souls.
text.46:
Furthermore, Allah swt explains that when the Messenger of Allah recited the Qur'an, Allah swt placed coverings over the hearts of the polytheists, so that their hearts could not understand the Qur'an, and placed plugs in their ears, so that they could not hear it. If in verse 45 above, Allah mentions the reasons that prevent them from understanding the Qur'an that comes from the outside, in this verse Allah swt mentions the reasons that come from within or that are found within themselves. They have experienced severe mental damage, so that they can no longer control their souls. Therefore, they are prevented from understanding the verses of the Qur'an that truly demand attention and concentration of thought. This mental damage is caused by their habit of following in the footsteps of their ancestors, even though what is followed is not true. They themselves acknowledge their mental damage, as mentioned in Allah's word in another verse:

And they say, "Our hearts are veiled from that to which you invite us, and in our ears is deafness, and between us and you is a partition, so work [as you will]; indeed, we are working." (Fushshilat/41: 5) (Also note Fushshilat/41: 44 and al-An'am/6: 25)

Furthermore, it is explained that when the Messenger of Allah mentions the name of Allah, the One and Only, in the Qur'an, without mentioning the names of their gods, they turn their backs, and distance themselves from it with an arrogant and haughty attitude. They feel offended because the Messenger of Allah only mentions the name of Allah, the One and Only, and does not mention the names of their idols in the Qur'an that is recited. They truly hate the Prophet, which is not only apparent in their words and attitudes, but is followed by acts of torture against the Muslims. They also hinder the activities of spreading Islamic da'wah among the residents of Mecca and its surroundings.
text.47:
Allah SWT explains to His Messenger that He is the One who knows their attitude when they listen to the Messenger of Allah reciting the Qur'an. They mock and deny it. Allah knows when they whisper to each other, saying, "Muhammad is insane." Some also say, "He is a soothsayer," and others say, "Muhammad is nothing but a man bewitched because his mind changes and is no longer consistent. Is it fitting for us to follow a madman like Muhammad?"

Allah SWT's saying:

And indeed, those who disbelieve would almost make you slip with their eyes when they hear the message, and they say, "Indeed, he is mad." (al-Qalam/68: 51)
text.48: Allah SWT then commanded the Messenger of Allah to observe how the polytheists made comparisons about him, such as saying that he was crazy, a poet, bewitched, and so on. Thus, they had gone astray, and would not receive guidance because they had deviated from the right path. The various comparisons they made to the Prophet Muhammad SAW when listening to him recite the Qur'an were statements born from their mental attitude towards the revelation that Allah had sent down to His Messenger. They actually did not want to acknowledge the truth of the revelation that the Messenger of Allah recited, because it brought explanations that contradicted the beliefs that had been blindly inherited from their ancestors. Therefore, they could no longer be expected to receive guidance and direction from the revelation, because their hearts had been shrouded by extraordinary stains of polytheism.
text.49:
Allah SWT explains to His Messenger what the polytheists of Mecca said regarding the Day of Resurrection. They said that if they had died and become decayed bones that were no longer intact, would they truly be resurrected as they were originally created? From their words, it is clear that they did not want to believe in the Day of Resurrection.

According to their belief, if humans have died and become scattered bones, especially if they have been completely destroyed, it is impossible for them to be gathered again and become the original beings who live as before. This is the main reason why they reject the truth of revelation and the prophethood of Muhammad SAW. Their denial of the Day of Resurrection is due to their attitude of equating something beyond their mental capacity with events that are usually experienced daily. In fact, the power to resurrect all creatures is in the hands of Allah SWT, who originally created them. All of that is beyond the capacity of their minds or intellect. If they paid attention to the signs of Allah's power in the heavens, on earth, and in all the objects around them, they would surely affirm the occurrence of the Day of Resurrection.

Allah SWT says:

"(The disbelievers) say, "Will we indeed be returned to (our) former state? Even after we are crumbled bones?" They say, "That would then be a losing return!" (an-Nazi'at/79: 10-12)

And he presents for Us an example and forgets his [own] creation. He says, "Who will give life to bones while they are disintegrated?" Say, "He will give them life who produced them the first time; and He is, of all creation, Knowing." (Yasin/36: 78-79)
text.50:
Allah SWT commanded His Messenger to provide an answer and explain to the polytheists of Mecca that Allah SWT has the power to resurrect them after they die, just as they were in the first instance of creation, regardless of their condition, whether it be bones, corpses, stones, iron, or anything else according to their understanding. Allah SWT commanded His Messenger to say to them, "Be you stones or iron." The meaning is that even if they have become stones or iron, or become anything that they deem unlikely to be brought back to life, Allah SWT actually has the power to bring them back to life. That is why Allah SWT commanded His Messenger to answer their doubts firmly that the One who will bring them back to life is the One who created them the first time. If Allah SWT had the power to create them in the first instance from earth, He also has the power to bring them back to life after they have become earth.

Then it is explained that they will shake their heads upon hearing the explanation of the Messenger of Allah as a sign that they are denying him and truly cannot accept the occurrence of the Day of Resurrection. This attitude is also a sign that they will ask when the Day of Resurrection will occur, and when they will be resurrected as new beings. Similar questions are stated in other verses. Allah says:

"And they (the disbelievers) say, "When is this promise (of resurrection), if you should be truthful?" (Yasin/36: 48)

Those who do not believe in the Day of Judgment seek to hasten it. (ash-Shura/42: 18)

On the Day of Resurrection, humans will be resurrected, reassembled from their tailbone. The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said:

"Indeed, in the human body there is a bone that will never be consumed by the earth. From that bone, humans will be reassembled on the Day of Resurrection." The companions asked, "What bone is that, O Messenger of Allah?" He replied, "The tailbone." (Narrated by Muslim from Abu Hurairah)

At the end of the verse, Allah SWT commanded His Messenger to say to the polytheists that they must prepare themselves to face the Day of Resurrection, because its time is near, and it is indeed certain to come. The Arabs usually say something that will come and is certain to happen, by saying that its time is near, even if it is a long time away. In this case, Allah SWT does not specify when the Day of Resurrection will come to all of His creatures, neither to the angels nor to His Messenger. He only informs that the Day of Resurrection is certain to come in the near future.
text.51:
Allah SWT commanded His Messenger to provide an answer and explain to the polytheists of Mecca that Allah SWT has the power to resurrect them after they die, just as they were in the first instance of creation, regardless of their state, whether it be bones, corpses, stones, iron, or anything else according to their understanding. Allah SWT commanded His Messenger to say to them, "Be you stones or iron." The meaning is that even if they have become stones or iron, or become anything they deem unlikely to be revived, Allah SWT actually has the power to bring them back to life. That is why Allah SWT commanded His Messenger to answer their doubts firmly that the One who will revive them is the One who created them the first time. If Allah SWT had the power to create them the first time from earth, He also has the power to revive them after they become earth.

Then it is explained that they will shake their heads upon hearing the explanation of the Messenger of Allah as a sign that they are denying him and truly cannot accept the occurrence of the Day of Resurrection. This attitude is also a sign that they will ask when the Day of Resurrection will occur, and when they will be resurrected as new beings. Similar questions are stated in other verses. Allah says:

"And they (the disbelievers) say, "When will this promise (of resurrection) be, if you should be truthful?" (Yasin/36: 48)

Those who do not believe in the Day of Judgment seek to hasten it. (ash-Shura/42: 18)

On the Day of Resurrection, humans will be resurrected, reassembled from their tailbone. The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said:

"Indeed, in the human body there is a bone that will never be consumed by the earth. From that bone, humans will be reassembled on the Day of Resurrection." The companions asked, "What bone is that, O Messenger of Allah?" He replied, "The tailbone." (Narrated by Muslim from Abu Hurairah)

At the end of the verse, Allah SWT commanded His Messenger to say to the polytheists that they must prepare to face the Day of Resurrection, because its time is near, and it will certainly come. The Arabs usually say something that will come and is certain to happen, by saying its time is near even if it is a long time away. In this case, Allah SWT does not specify when the Day of Resurrection will come to all His creatures, neither to the angels nor to His Messenger. He only informs that the Day of Resurrection will certainly come in the near future.
text.52:
Then it is explained that the Day of Resurrection is the day when Allah SWT calls all people, and they will obey the call while praising Him. The meaning is that on that day, Allah, with His omnipotence, calls all people. Then they rise from their graves while praising the power of Allah who has resurrected them according to the promise that has been established.

Allah SWT says:

And listen on the day when the caller (angel) calls from a place nearby. (That is) the day they hear the Cry of Truth. That is the Day of Resurrection. (Qaf/50: 41-42)

It is narrated in a *hadith marfu'* from Anas that he said, "Those who say, "There is no god but Allah," do not feel lonely in the grave. It is as if I am with them coming out of their graves wiping the dust from their heads, saying, "There is no god but Allah." In a narration from ath-Thabrani from Ibn Umar, they said, "All praise is due to Allah who has removed our sorrow." (Narrated by ath-Thabrani)

At the time of rising from the grave, they think that they lived in the world for not long, but only for a short time.

Allah SWT says:

On the Day they see it, it will be as though they had not remained (in the world) except an afternoon or a morning. (an-Nazi'at/79: 46) (Also note Yunus/10: 45)

Al-Hasan al-Bashri explained that what is meant by the nearness of the Day of Resurrection is that on that day you feel as if you had been in the world, (even though you were there for so long), and suddenly you are now in the Hereafter and undergoing the process of calculating good and bad deeds.
text.53:
Allah commanded the Messenger of Allah to tell all His servants to utter better words when speaking or debating with polytheists or others. They should not use harsh words and insults that would cause hatred, but should use words that are true and contain good lessons.

Allah SWT says:

"Invite to the way of your Lord with wisdom and good instruction..." (an-Nahl/16: 125). See also al-'Ankabut/29: 46.

Allah SWT explains the reason for His prohibition, namely that Satan can disrupt the atmosphere and spread disaster among the believers and the polytheists when they speak harshly and disagree. Disagreements among them can lead to conflict, even fighting. In this regard, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) once forbade a Muslim man from pointing at him with a piece of iron, because he was afraid that Satan would release the weapon from his hand and it would hit the Messenger. This would cause the person to sin and be put into hell.

Narrated by Imam Ahmad from Abu Hurairah, he said that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said:

"None of you should point a weapon at his brother, for indeed he does not know, perhaps Satan will release the weapon from his hand, so he will enter the valley of hell." (Riwayat Imam Ahmad dari Abu Hurairah)

Then Allah affirms that Satan is a clear enemy to mankind. The enmity between the two has been going on for a long time. In another verse, Allah SWT says:

"Then I will come to them from before them and behind them and on their right and on their left..." (al-A'raf/7: 17)
text.54:
Allah SWT explains that He is the Most Knowing about the condition of those polytheists. If Allah willed, He would certainly bestow His mercy by granting them His *taufik* and *hidayah*, so that they would be saved from error and become obedient people. But if He willed to punish them, they would certainly not obtain *hidayah* to believe.

In this verse, there is an indication that Muslims should not insult the polytheists, and call them inhabitants of hell. The certainty of a person entering hell or not is a matter of the unseen (*ghaib*) that only Allah SWT knows. Muslims should also not do anything that makes them ashamed, because that only causes them to be envious and creates hostility.

At the end of the verse, it is emphasized that Allah did not send His Messenger to force them to do what pleases Him. Rather, Allah sent him as a bearer of good news and a warner. That is why Allah forbade the Messenger of Allah from forcing them, and commanded all his companions to be open-minded.
text.55:
This verse explains that Allah SWT knows best the condition of His servants in the heavens and on earth, both what is visible and what is not. He chooses from among His servants who is worthy to receive the task of prophethood and religious knowledge. He also elevates some servants above others, according to His knowledge and power alone.

This verse is also a refutation of the polytheists who said that it was highly unlikely that Muhammad, who was only an orphan and raised by his uncle, Abu Talib, would become a prophet. If his followers were only hungry people, dressed in rags, it was impossible for nobles and Quraysh leaders to become his followers.

The mention that Allah knows best His creatures in the heavens and on earth in this verse is a refutation of their assumptions and desires that Allah should send angels or great men from Mecca or Taif to be His messengers. Allah says:

"Why were not angels sent down to us?" (al-Furqan/25: 21)

Allah also says:

"And they say, "Why was this Qur'an not sent down upon a great man from [one of] the two cities?" (az-Zukhruf/43: 31)

Among Allah's servants who are chosen to be His messengers are those who have spiritual virtues and pure souls. Allah SWT elevates some prophets above others according to His choice as well, such as Prophet Ibrahim being given the privilege of being called Khalilullah (Friend of Allah) and Prophet Musa being given the privilege of being called Kalimullah (Speaker with Allah). Prophet Muhammad was given the highest miracle of all miracles, which is the Al-Qur'an, and was given the honor of facing directly His presence during Isra' and Mi'raj.

Allah SWT says:

"Those messengers - some of them We caused to exceed others. Among them were those to whom Allah spoke, and We raised some of them in degree. And We gave Jesus, the son of Mary, clear proofs and supported him with the Holy Spirit." (al-Baqarah/2: 253)

At the end of the verse, Allah mentions that He gave the Zabur to Daud (David) a.s. Thus, it can be understood that the virtue of Prophet Daud is not only because he became a king, but also because he received a book from Allah.

The specific mention of Zabur in this verse is because it is mentioned in that book that Prophet Muhammad is the final prophet and his ummah is a good ummah as well.

Allah SWT says:

"And We have already written in the book [of Psalms] after the mention [of it in the Law of Moses] that the earth will be inherited by My righteous servants." (al-Anbiya'/21: 105)

What is meant by "My righteous servants" in the verse above is Prophet Muhammad and his ummah.
text.56:
The *sabab nuzul* (reason for revelation) of this verse is as narrated by al-Bukhari from Ibn Mas'ud, that there were people who worshipped humans and jinn. Some of those jinn embraced Islam, while others remained in their beliefs. Thus, this verse was revealed.

In this verse, Allah commands His Messenger to say to the polytheists of Mecca the following statement, "When you are afflicted with danger, such as poverty and the onset of disease, try calling upon those whom you consider gods besides Allah, are those gods able to remove the danger that befalls you?" Thus, in this verse, Allah affirms that those whom they consider gods will not be able to repel the danger or transfer it to another person. This is because they indeed do not have the power to do so. The One who has the power and ability to remove that danger is the Creator of this universe and also their Creator, namely Allah, the One and Only. Therefore, it is Allah who must be worshipped.
text.57:
It has been mentioned above that the polytheists worshipped angels, jinn, Prophet Isa (Jesus), and 'Uzair (Ezra). They considered them as gods who could remove their dangers and harms. Then Allah mentions that those whom they worship themselves are actually seeking *wasilah* (a means) to draw closer to Him. That path is none other than obedience to Allah's commands and avoidance of His prohibitions.

Imam at-Tirmidhi and Ibn Mardawaih narrated a hadith from Abu Hurairah, who said:

The Messenger of Allah (saw) said, "Ask Allah for *wasilah* for me." They asked, "What is *wasilah*?" The Prophet (saw) said, "Drawing closer to Allah." Then the Prophet recited this verse (verse 57).

Furthermore, Allah explains that even the closest people, among the angels, jinn, Prophet Isa (Jesus), and 'Uzair (Ezra), to Allah still seek *wasilah* to draw closer to Him, by obeying and enslaving themselves to Him. Therefore, are they worthy of being worshipped? Why don't you just worship Allah directly?

In the final part of this verse, Allah SWT mentions that indeed the punishment of the Lord is something that (must) be feared by anyone, whether the angels, His messengers and prophets, or all of mankind.
text.58:
Allah SWT gives a warning to the polytheists of Mecca who deny the occurrence of the Day of Resurrection, the Day of Judgment, and the prophethood of Muhammad, that there is no land whose inhabitants are disobedient, but that it will be completely destroyed, before the Day of Judgment comes or is struck by a terrible disaster because of their sins and denial of the prophets who were sent to them.

Allah SWT says:

And how many a city rebelled against the command of their Lord and His messengers, so We called them to a severe account and punished them with a terrible punishment (in the Hereafter). So they tasted the evil consequences of their deeds, and the outcome of their deeds was a great loss. (ath-Thalaq/65: 8-9)

Allah SWT explains that this has been recorded in the Book of Allah, as narrated by Imam at-Tirmidhi from 'Ubadah bin shamit, he said, "I heard the Messenger of Allah SAW say:

Indeed, the first thing created by Allah was the qalam (pen), then Allah SWT said to the qalam, "Write," then the qalam said, "What shall I write?" Allah SWT said, "Write what has been decreed, and what will happen until the Day of Judgment." (Narrated by Imam at-Tirmidhi from 'Ubadah bin shamit)
text.59:
Imam Ahmad narrated from Ibn 'Abbas that he said, "The people of Mecca asked the Prophet saw to turn Mount Safa into a mountain of gold, and to remove the hills so that the land could be used for agriculture. An angel said to the Prophet, "If you want to fulfill their request, fulfill it. If they deny it, they can be destroyed like previous peoples." The Prophet said, "But I want to postpone their request." Then Allah revealed this verse."

Allah explains that nothing can prevent the implementation of the miracle given to His Messenger. People of the past who denied the signs of His power (miracles) as had been given to His previous messengers, would be destroyed. Likewise, the Quraysh who asked the Prophet Muhammad saw, that Allah also send down signs of His power to them. However, Allah did not grant it, because if those signs of Allah's power were sent down, they would surely deny them as well and they would certainly be destroyed like the people of the past. But Allah will not destroy the Quraysh, because among their descendants there are those who are expected to become believers.

Allah swt explains that He had given signs of His power (His miracles) to the Prophet Saleh, as requested by the people of Thamud, namely a female camel that they could witness themselves.

The Messenger of Allah said:

Narrated from ar-Rabi' bin Anas, he said, "The Quraysh people said to the Messenger of Allah saw, "(We want to believe), if signs of Allah's power are brought to us, like those brought by the Prophet Saleh and the prophets (to their people)." Then the Messenger of Allah saw said, "If you all want me to pray to Allah, Allah will surely send down (those signs of power) to you. But if you also rebel, you will surely be destroyed." Then they said, "We do not want it." (Narrated by al-Baihaqi)

Allah explains that in the end, the people of Thamud still did not become believers, they even abused the female camel that was the miracle of the Prophet Saleh and slaughtered it. Allah swt then destroyed them because of their sins, and leveled them to the ground.

At the end of this verse, Allah swt explains that He gives these signs of power to remind people to take lessons from them, so that they repent and return to following Allah swt's guidance as proclaimed by His prophets and messengers.
text.60:
Abu Ya'la from Ummi Hani narrated that the morning after Isra', some of the Quraysh mocked the Messenger of Allah and asked for proof. Then he described the state of Baitul Maqdis and told them about the story of Isra'. Then Walid bin Mugirah said, "This man is a magician." Then this verse was revealed.

Allah swt gave support to the Messenger of Allah in carrying out his prophetic duties and would protect him from the deception of those who denied his message by reminding the Messenger and revealing to him that God's knowledge encompasses all human affairs. The meaning is that Allah is Almighty over all His servants. They are under His control so that they cannot move except according to His provisions. Allah is able to protect His Messenger from those who oppose him, so that they cannot arbitrarily hurt his feelings.

Allah swt says:

And Allah will protect you from the (harm of) people. (al-Ma'idah/5: 67)

According to al-Hasan, Allah swt will prevent every effort they make to kill the Prophet. Allah swt says:

And (remember) when those who disbelieved plotted against you to restrain you or kill you or evict you [from Makkah]. But they plan, and Allah plans. And Allah is the best of planners. (al-Anfal/8: 30)

Allah also explained the denial of the Quraysh people of what was shown to the Prophet Muhammad on the night of Isra' and Mi'raj, such as the zaqqum tree that grows in hell. This is as a test, who among his people truly believes and who disbelieves. Those who truly believe have their faith strengthened, but those whose faith is only in words, increase in disbelief. The zaqqum tree mentioned in the Qur'an also became a test for them, when they heard the Muslims recite the verse:

Indeed, the tree of Zaqqum is food for the sinful. (ad-Dukhan/44: 43-44)

They disputed it; those whose faith was strong, their faith became stronger, but those who denied the prophethood of Muhammad saw increased in disbelief. Abu Jahal, for example, was among those who denied it. At that time he said, "Actually, the son of Abu Kabsyah (Muhammad saw) threatens you with the threat of hell, whose fuel is stone, then he thinks that a tree grows in hell, even though you know that fire burns trees." 'Abdullah bin az-Zibara said, "Actually, Muhammad frightens us with the zaqqum tree, which is nothing but dates and cheese, so swallow it." They then ate the dates and cheese.

The polytheists of Quraysh did not believe that there were plants in hell called the zaqqum tree, because they assumed that fire destroys everything. They did not know that in this world there are also amazing wonders, especially in the afterlife. For example, in the world there is a kind of fiber that is not burned by fire (asbestos). This material is often used for fireproof clothing. The earth contains fire (namely magma) in the bowels of the earth which will be seen when a volcano erupts, but above it grow green trees. Wood or stone can also produce fire when rubbed together. Even in water there is an element of oxygen that causes fire to burn. In short, the hearts of the disbelieving Quraysh people did not want to accept the truth of the Qur'an. Their denial of ar-ru'ya (the dream or what the Prophet saw at the time of Isra') and the zaqqum tree is clear evidence of their denial.

Allah swt says:

Indeed, We have made it (the tree of Zaqqum) a trial for the wrongdoers. Indeed, it is a tree issuing from the bottom of Hellfire, Its emerging fruit as if it was heads of devils. (ash-shaffat/37: 63-65)

At the end of the verse it is emphasized that Allah wants to remind them of His punishment, but that will only increase them in wickedness and error.
text.61:
Allah swt commanded the Messenger of Allah to remind his people of the enmity of Iblis towards Adam and his descendants. This enmity has been ongoing since the creation of Adam. When Allah swt commanded the angels to prostrate in homage to Adam, they prostrated to him, except for Iblis. He felt more noble and refused the command of Allah. This attitude was caused by his arrogance, as depicted in his words, "Should I prostrate to Adam, whom You created from clay, while I was created from fire?" According to Iblis's assumption, fire is more noble than clay.

Iblis's words are similarly expressed in another verse, as mentioned in Allah's word:

"(Iblis) said, "I am better than him. You created me from fire, and You created him from clay." (shad/38: 76)

Iblis became a disbeliever because he did not obey Allah's command and was arrogant. He assumed that Allah swt had commanded something that was not appropriate. Iblis's assumption was merely his own imagination. His assumption that fire is more noble than clay is an incorrect assumption, because fire and clay are both creatures of Allah. Allah created them from nothing, then made one more useful than the other, according to His wisdom. Fire can burn, while clay can grow things. Both support human life. So, by nature, neither can be considered superior to the other. Both have their respective advantages.
text.62:
Then it is explained that Iblis's audacity and disobedience to Allah's command occurred when he asked Allah to explain to him the reason why he had to prostrate to Adam. Iblis's request was expressed in the form of a question intended to show his astonishment at hearing Allah's command to prostrate to Adam. Because of this denial, Iblis received wrath and became far from Allah's mercy.

That is why Iblis pleaded with Allah to postpone his punishment and death until the Day of Judgment and to be given the opportunity to tempt and mislead Adam's descendants, except for a small portion of his descendants who are indeed strong in faith.

Allah SWT says:

"Indeed, you (Iblis) have no authority over My servants, except those who follow you of the deviators." (al-Hijr/15:42)
text.63:
Allah granted Iblis' request and allowed him to go according to his desires and carry out his deceptions until the Day of Judgment arrives. However, Allah stipulated that whoever among the descendants of Adam is deceived into following Iblis, their recompense will be Hell Jahannam as a punishment that must be inflicted upon them. Likewise, the punishment inflicted upon those who follow his call, because they dare to deviate from Allah's commands and violate His prohibitions.

Allah SWT says:

Allah said, "(Alright), then indeed, you are of those reprieved, Until the Day of the time appointed (the Day of Resurrection)." (al-Hijr/15: 37-38)
text.64:
This verse further explains the extent of Iblis's ability to tempt the descendants of Adam on this earth. Allah SWT allows Iblis to incite anyone among the descendants of Adam, according to his ability and capability, with enticements and deceptions. Iblis's deception to tempt the descendants of Adam is depicted as a commander deploying a cavalry army, reinforced by an infantry army. They attack their enemies with a thunderous sound to startle them into submission and surrender to his power.

Regarding the interpretation of this verse, Imam Mujahid explained that every cavalry army used to attack the enemy by violating the laws of Allah is an army tempted by Iblis. And the infantry army that fights by violating the provisions of Allah is included in the army of Iblis.

Another *mufassir* explains that Satan no longer has a cavalry army or an infantry army. The meaning of the analogy is as a depiction of Iblis's followers and supporters, regardless of their condition, whether the acting supporters or followers are cavalry or infantry.

As a clear illustration, Allah likens Iblis and his followers in tempting the descendants of Adam to people who jointly accumulate wealth and children, which encourages them to fall into disobedience and follow their desires.

In short, it can be said that Iblis strives with all his might to tempt the descendants of Adam, so that they fall into Allah's prohibitions. Iblis tempts their hearts to be attracted to religions that are not pleasing to Allah, tempting them to commit adultery, or enjoy killing and burying their children alive.

Allah also allows Iblis to make promises to the descendants of Adam with promises that can deceive them so that they are lulled away from His commands and violate His prohibitions. However, Satan's promises are only deception, not a single temptation can prevent the punishment of Allah that will be inflicted upon them. Satan's promises are only captivating deceptions so that they are no longer able to distinguish between what is right and what is wrong.

Allah SWT says:

And Satan will say when the matter has been concluded, "Indeed, Allah had promised you the promise of truth. And I promised you, but I betrayed you. But I had no authority over you except that I invited you, and you responded to me. So do not blame me; but blame yourselves. (Ibrahim/14: 22)
text.65:
Furthermore, Allah swt explains the limitations of Iblis's temptations towards the descendants of Adam by affirming that, in reality, Allah's servants who always obey His commands and avoid His prohibitions will not be affected by his temptations. Iblis has no power to force them to submit to his deceptions. Iblis's ability is only to tempt. Those who can be influenced are those who do not have strong faith. Therefore, Allah swt affirms at the end of this verse that for those who have strong faith, it is sufficient to surrender to Allah and ask for His protection in order to be free from the temptations and deceptions of Satan.

In this verse, there is an indication that humans fundamentally do not have immunity to the temptations of Satan and do not have personal control that saves them from error. Immunity and personal control are only the protection and abundance of Allah swt's mercy.
text.66:
In this verse, it is explained that Allah moves the ships in the seas for His servants, so that they can utilize these ships as a means of transporting necessities of life from one land to another. Through this transportation, the prosperity found in one land can be transferred to another.

At the end of the verse, it is emphasized that Allah is truly Most Merciful towards all His servants, because wherever humans direct their gaze, they will surely witness various countless blessings of Allah, which are signs of the greatness of His power.
text.67:
Then Allah reveals the state of the disbelievers when struck by calamities that threaten their lives. They cannot expect help except from Allah, who has the power to bring benefit and ward off harm. Allah SWT states that when disbelievers are struck by calamities at sea, their hope of seeking help and assistance from idols, jinn, angels, trees, and stones that they worship vanishes. At that critical moment, all they remember is Allah, the One and Only, who has the power and ability to remove the danger, so they ask for His help. However, when Allah has granted their request, that is, they have escaped from the disaster of typhoons and storms that almost drowned them, and arrive safely on land, they turn back into people who deny Allah's blessings and return to associating partners with Him.

Allah affirms that human nature tends to forget the blessings they receive and are always unfaithful or unwilling to be grateful to the Being who gives those blessings. This is a strangeness found in humans except for His servants who are always under His guidance and protection.
text.68:
Allah threatens those who deny His blessings, those who think that because they were saved from the threat of typhoons and storms, they are safe from the punishment of Allah, the One who has the power to overturn parts of the land, so that they are buried into the depths of the earth. If He wills, Allah has the power to blow strong winds and rain them with small stones so that they disappear in a very short time from the surface of this earth. In such a situation, they will not find a protector who is able to save them from the disaster except Allah, the Almighty, who gives life and death to all His creatures.

In short, it can be said that disasters can happen everywhere. Even if they are saved from the disaster that threatens them in the ocean, in the form of typhoons and storms, on land a more terrible disaster may occur, such as earthquakes, hail, floods, and so on. All of this is within the power of Allah who created the heavens and the earth and all the creatures that are between them.
text.69: Furthermore, it is explained that Allah has the power to return those who deny His blessings to the sea again, after they feel safe on land. Do they feel safe from the disaster that will befall them in the sea after they reach land? Allah has the power to return them to the sea again, by sending hurricanes and tsunamis that are very powerful. The wind sweeps them from the land, so they will be engulfed by waves that can drown them. At times of experiencing such a terrible disaster, they will not find anyone who can help to release them from Allah's punishment.
text.70:
Allah has honored Bani Adam, that is, humans, above all other creatures, whether angels, jinn, all types of animals, and plants. The superiority of humans over other creatures is both physical and non-physical, as Allah says:

"We have certainly created man in the best of stature; Then We return him to the lowest of the low, Except for those who believe and do righteous deeds, for they will have a reward uninterrupted." (at-Tin/95: 4-6)

In addition to being given perfect senses, humans are also given a heart that functions to weigh and make decisions. Allah says:

"And Allah has extracted you from the wombs of your mothers not knowing a thing, and He made for you hearing and vision and hearts [i.e., intellect] that perhaps you would be grateful." (an-Nahl/16: 78)

This honor of humanity is in accordance with its task as a caliph on earth. Allah says:

"And [mention, O Muhammad], when your Lord said to the angels, "Indeed, I will make upon the earth a successive authority." They said, "Will You place upon it one who causes corruption therein and sheds blood, while we declare Your praise and sanctify You?" Allah said, "Indeed, I know that which you do not know." (al-Baqarah/2: 30)

Nevertheless, many humans are unaware of the height of their status and therefore do not fulfill their function as mentioned in Allah's saying:

"And We have certainly created for Hell many of the jinn and mankind. They have hearts with which they do not understand, they have eyes with which they do not see, and they have ears with which they do not hear. Those are like livestock; rather, they are more misguided." (al-A'raf/7: 179)
text.71:
Allah SWT reminds His servants of the Day of Reckoning. On that day, Allah SWT will call people, each carrying their book containing a complete record of their deeds. At that time, they will receive a just judgment, according to the deeds they did in the world, all of which have been recorded in that book. So blessed are those who, when given their book of deeds, receive it in their right hand. They will read the book with joy, because they are happy to see the record of their good deeds.

Allah SWT says:

"Then as for him who is given his record in his right hand, he will say, "Here, read my record!" (al-Haqqah/69: 19)

Also His saying:

"Then as for him who is given his record in his right hand, he will be judged with an easy account." (al-Inshiqaq/84: 7-8)

Allah then affirms that they will not be wronged in the least. This means that the reward they should receive will not be reduced in the slightest, because the One who created the Hereafter is also the One who created this world, so it is impossible for Him to reduce the reward they should receive. Allah SWT is Most Just, and His justice is evident in His creation in this world.
text.72: Then it is explained that whoever is blind of heart in the world, meaning those who do not want to see the truth of Allah's guidance, and do not want to pay attention to the signs of His power, then in the Hereafter they will be even more blind and unable to find a way to save themselves from the torment of hell. Indeed, they are even more astray than their condition in the world, because their soul at that time is the same soul as it was in the world. The soul that Allah SWT resurrects in the Hereafter is the soul that came out of its body when it died, like fruits that emerge from their branches. The fruit and the branch have the same characteristics. Likewise, the human soul at that time, it rises carrying all its characteristics, morals, and deeds. It knows its own condition. It feels happy or miserable according to its own condition. If the condition of the human soul is negligent in the world, it will also be negligent in the Hereafter because it has neglected various means and tools to master knowledge, and is accustomed to being lazy in carrying out Allah's commands. It will then curse and reproach itself.
text.73:
In this verse, it is explained the efforts made by the Quraysh polytheists to deceive the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him), to the point that he was almost tricked, turning away from the revelation he had received from Allah (SWT), and fulfilling their request to acknowledge their gods. Because of Allah's protection, the Prophet was able to remain steadfast in his mission of spreading the da'wah, even though the pressure from the Quraysh people became increasingly intense.

Allah reminds His Messenger that if he were to follow what they desired, they would certainly take him as a friend or elevate him to a leader. They would also declare before the people that the Prophet (peace be upon him) had agreed to and acknowledged their religion. Thus, the Prophet (peace be upon him) would be distanced from the guidance and direction of Allah (SWT).
text.74:
In this verse, it is explained that the Prophet Muhammad almost became influenced if Allah had not strengthened his heart to face the pressure and deception of the Quraysh people, so that he did not turn away even slightly.

From the explanation of this verse, it can be understood that the Messenger of Allah (saw) was inclined to approach the Quraysh people. This was not because the Prophet's (saw) heart was weak, but it shows that the pressure and deception were very great. It was only because of Allah's help that the Messenger did not end up approaching them.
text.75:
Allah SWT reminds His Messenger that if he were to be influenced by the pressure of the disbelievers, Allah would inflict a double punishment upon him, both in this world and in the hereafter. Thus, the degree of punishment for the Messenger of Allah is twice that of the punishment for others, as is the case for the wives of the Prophet. In this regard, Allah SWT says:

"O wives of the Prophet, whoever of you commits a clear immorality - for her the punishment will be doubled, and ever is that, for Allah, easy." (al-Ahzab/33: 30)

If the wives of the Prophet were to slip and follow the temptations of their desires, their punishment would be twice that of ordinary women. From this verse, it is understood that the punishment for scholars, intellectuals, and other community leaders, if they err, will be greater than the punishment for ordinary people.

And they will say, "Our Lord, indeed we obeyed our masters and our great ones, and they led us astray from the [right] way. Our Lord, give them double the punishment and curse them with a great curse." (al-Ahzab/33: 67-68)

Allah SWT reminds the Prophet SAW that if he were to fulfill the desires of the polytheists, Allah would punish him doubly, both in this world and in the hereafter. He would not find a helper who could deliver him from that punishment. It is imperative for every Muslim to make this verse a guide in every step they take in religion.
text.76:
This verse reveals how the various pressures faced by the Messenger of Allah and the Muslims almost made him unable to endure remaining in Mecca, especially after the Quraysh infidels made plans to kill him. This event was the background to the Hijrah (migration) to Medina.

Allah conveyed His threat through the Messenger of Allah to the Quraysh infidels that if the Prophet and the Muslims were expelled from Mecca, Allah would not allow it. In a short time, they would be destroyed by Allah, and subsequently, the city of Mecca would be controlled again by the believers (Mukminin). Allah's promise was proven by the killing of the Quraysh leaders in the Battle of Badr, which occurred in the second year after the Prophet's Hijrah to Medina, and the conquest of the city of Mecca in the 8th year of Hijrah.
text.77:
This verse explains the general laws of Allah, as experienced by the messengers and prophets before. They experienced severe pressures and were expelled by their people. But in the end, Allah granted victory to the Muslims and punished those who disbelieved. Similarly, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) and his followers were not spared from the pressure and persecution of the polytheists of Mecca.
